When ProjectFacetsManager.create(..) is called with null passed in for the IProgressMonitor, the Exception below occurs. To be consistent with the rest of Eclipse API, a null IProgressMonitor should work.

org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.AssertionFailedException: null argument:
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isNotNull(Assert.java:82)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isNotNull(Assert.java:69)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.ProgressMonitorWrapper.<init>(ProgressMonitorWrapper.java:34)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SubProgressMonitor.<init>(SubProgressMonitor.java:91)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SubProgressMonitor.<init>(SubProgressMonitor.java:71)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.create(ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.java:311)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.ProjectFacetsManager.create(ProjectFacetsManager.java:287)

Copying a related comment by cbrealey@ca.ibm.com from another bug:

On a much, much less serious note, the JavaDoc for a couple of the Facet
methods I happened to look at did not declare that a null progress monitor was
allowed. This is obviously not a technical issue, and may also have been a
couple of isolated cases since I only peeked at a couple of methods, but I
would recommend updating your JavaDoc by stealing the following line commonly
found across the Eclipse platform and in Server tools: "monitor - a progress
monitor, or null if progress reporting and cancellation are not desired".
Released the fix to both 1.0.1 and 1.5 code streams.
